tool.name: Genbank to Fasta
tool.description: Takes a GenBank or EMBL format file as input, and outputs a fasta file
tool.command:
which genbank_to_fasta.py;
genbank_to_fasta.py -i '$input_file' -o '$output_fasta'
-m 'genbank'
-d ${delimiter_type.delimiter}
#if $feature_extraction.features == "whole":
-u '${feature_extraction.header}'
#else:
-s '${feature_extraction.output_sequence_type.seq_type}'
#if $feature_extraction.feature_to_extract.extract == "other"
-f ${feature_extraction.feature_to_extract.other_feature}
#else:
-f ${$feature_extraction.feature_to_extract.extract}
#end if
-q `echo ${feature_extraction.qualifiers} | sed -e 's/ //g'`
#end if

param.name: delimiter
param.label: Header Item Delimiter Character. Default is space pipe (' |')

param.name: header
param.label: If you wish, you may specify a custom header line for your fasta file. Omit the leading “>” character.

param.name: seq_type
param.label: Output Sequence Type
param.option: Amino Acid sequence translated on the fly

param.name: qualifiers
param.label: Qualifiers to use in the Fasta Header line. Takes comma separated list. Will accept any qualifier that appears in your genbank file, (e.g. note,protein_id,etc). Qualifiers appear in the header line in the order you list them. Use 'location_long' for the exact location information as it appears in the input file. Default is 'locus_tag,gene,product,location'.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Runs a script that extracts the fasta info from genbank files.
------
